title: Question 17
prompt:
Sentence 2: Because State Financial Services are a professional, customer-service firm, it’s important that the firm’s employees look successful and businesslike.

Which correction should be made to sentence 2?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The subject of the subordinate clause is “State Financial Services,” the name of the business. Because this is the name of one business, it is singular, but the verb “are” is plural. The verb and subject don’t match. Because the subject is singular, the verb should be singular. The verb “are” is plural. The correct singular verb form is “is.”


Because State Financial Services is a professional, customer-service firm, it’s important that the firm’s employees look successful and businesslike.
